snippet: Newtown Creek, a Superfund site once home to a long list of polluting industries, has its own enthusiastic historian in Mitch Waxman.
abstract: Artist Mitch Waxman has become a self-taught expert on Newtown Creek, body of water separating Greenpoint, Brooklyn from Queens that is also a federal Superfund site; Waxman has parlayed his fascination with the darker aspects of the creek's history into a blog, a guided tour and a position as resident historian for the Newtown Creek Alliance, an environmental advocacy group.
lead_paragraph: Newtown Creek, a Superfund site once home to a long list of polluting industries, has its own enthusiastic historian in Mitch Waxman.

headline.seo: Mitch Waxman, Tour Guide to Decay
headline.main: Your Guide to a Tour of Decay
headline.print_headline: Your Guide On a Tour of Decay
